attributes.action: Change the way the cost of T.V Licence is worked out.
attributes.additional_details: I'm asking you to sign this petition if you think this is unfair for someone to pay on average more a week on TV licence than they do on electric a week. Your average BBC worker makes £37 an hour is it fair that the ones that watch the BBC less in a week or not at all are made to pay the same amount of the ones that watch it a lot more. Let's get this debated in Parliament and let's get it where they go on your circumstances and how often you watch the BBC rather than if you have a colour TV or a black and white TV.
attributes.background: I have had enough of how much I got to pay the BBC for watching each year it cost's £147 for a colour TV licence. I have worked out that I only watch the BBC for 2 hours a week this working out on average of £24.50 a week.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly how you would like the TV licence fee to be determined. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
